title: Grade 3
subject: Alternative Content Standards - English Language Arts (2017-)

document.title: ESSENTIAL ELEMENTS FOR GRADE 3: ENGLISH LANGUAGE ARTS

1518C8498CE041B0BDDD6765B5525BDC.description:
Create a multimedia
presentation of a story or poem.

249B12A1721D4B88A9D0FA764BEA090A.description:
The student can
contribute to class brainstorming
sessions to generate ideas for group
writing projects.

215191C06C1E462686E3E0D9FA5EDF05.description:
The student can
choose pieces of information that
are related to a given topic in
preparation for a class writing
project.

3A9AF7E51DC040F298E29F0A705E8CB2.description:
The student can sort
information into categories in
preparation for a writing project.

483445511C4249F082C4E0D0CBAAA4F9.description:
Sort information on a
topic or personal experience into
two provided categories and
write about each one.

204D64A942C14998AC666C6F455F176D.description:
Identify information
about a topic for a research
project.

05BE82DA1F8B4494A2195849D18F188A.description:
With guidance and
support from adults, use
technology to produce writing
while interacting and
collaborating with others.

4D5E0ED7E5324C0E9FF00D75D4957EE6.description:
The student can
identify an opinion of a character in
a short narrative text.

F5017FE1792D421A91B1452517CCEF2E.description:
The student can
identify words/phrases that express
an opinion of a character in a given
text.

7EE765E950304A559C2F66D840D0E77B.description:
The student can
identify reasons to support an
opinion about a given topic or text
(the opinion may belong to the
student, character, or author of a
given text).

86ED96780C4C4CAA81DE2878E7B908BE.description:
Write opinions
about topics or text

D37F549E904C46BA8F1E9DE4E1B25D07.description: Students can investigate topics and present information.

C225901A38694EA2ACD4612E8BCB385A.description:
Demonstrate
understanding of words that
signal spatial and temporal
relationships. (e.g., behind,
under, after, soon, next, later.)

E4E0B67C077446D7A4E79BAF449AF784.description:
The student can identify
the correct use of language to
communicate effectively with
familiar people (e.g., sharing
information, responding to
greetings, being polite, and making
simple requests, etc.).

44CA67721CCC40C79389633AB05B5016.description:
The student can use
language to communicate
effectively with a variety of
audiences and for different
purposes (e.g., asking questions,
sharing information, responding to
greetings, using polite expressions,
using appropriate body language).

D2E220D146E24805A19BF96B59D01AE0.description:
The student can
identify the correct use of language
to communicate effectively with a
variety of audiences and for
different purposes (e.g., asking and
answering questions, sharing
information, and advocating for
oneself).

8954F55A7D4F443E9E88D91D9841CDE5.description:
Use language to achieve
desired outcomes when
communicating

38CB44C75F014858BDA54345FFFBCA67.description:
The student can identify
the correct grammatical use of
nouns when presented in context.

07AF32EEED134C3180F943CD8E94F5AD.description:
The student can
identify/demonstrate the correct
grammatical use of nouns and/or
pronouns when presented in
context.

FB6CE18F040B490BA8A8BCDAABF8C118.description:
The student can
identify the correct use of
grammatical structures (e.g.,
singular/plural nouns, appropriate
pronouns, present/past tense
verbs) when communicating.

79E4175C513E4A70A27E13CAC1CA36E6.description:
Demonstrate Standard
English grammar and usage when
communicating

9BB5C69C5F564D90B5B65758B7260ED3.description:
Combine words for
effective communication to
clarify thoughts, feelings, and
ideas in various contexts.

2F15FDE7E1474ABDA684A71980106B1F.description:
Recount a personal
experience, story, or topic
including details.

C457C4BEB735493897299639F977458A.description:
Ask or answer
questions about details provided
by the speaker.

5E39B671A15342F4A9DAECD11E42B9DE.description:
The student can select a
detail from a text presented orally or
through other media.

EF94C1B4243F4A5D94AAEE986E8DE65F.description:
The student can
respond to basic questions about
details presented orally or
through other media.

9F5B1F664947436297A86D2B32363BC1.description:
The student can
respond to questions about details
presented orally or through other
media.

2149DF45737641D8B3E856FE14B1AA6A.description:
Identify details in a
text read aloud or information
presented orally through other
media.

941111FCE5F5427F97AE6B6E36502FFD.description: Students can communicate for a range of purposes and audiences.

C5AFF36114444CAF926E2498BDD777D1.description:
The student can
differentiate between a word and a
simple sentence.

297140D990904B2688023E9078F726DF.description:
The student can
identify correct capitalization
and/or end punctuation (period
and question mark).

584DEFA2552741AEA85A8B10FF8F6538.description:
The student can
identify that the first word in a
sentence should be capitalized
and/or choose the correct ending
punctuation (period, question
mark, or exclamation point).

67F3F17D2E4444B6AD8D18E655C4AC39.description:
Demonstrate
understanding of conventions of
Standard English

0ED01938A6BC4C9B9C9660BB4CB8BFAE.description:
Write routinely for a
variety of tasks, purposes, and
audiences.

D5C82E44345F49EFB4CC8842B88778E5.description:
With guidance and
support from adults and peers,
revise own writing.

716824C6EBCD44F2A6EDD34F31888893.description:
With guidance and
support, produce writing that
expresses more than one idea.

8A9F30E0AFBE43FEB789CE373E49428E.description:
The student can
select a word or picture to share
information about an event or
personal experience.

7014D90C532D47CBA147681D55CD0921.description:
The student can
identify details from an event or
personal experience.

DE0092E56DAD4476A486E8306DA373CB.description:
The student can
write/dictate/draw a personal
narrative about an event or
personal experience.

D2E9D4B5661B4C5E881C9B21E39CB022.description:
Write about events
or personal experiences

B267866D4F504B7AA3819828881723CF.description:
The student can
select one fact or detail that is
related to a given topic or list of
details.

90A2563EF4CF4A89BD2609814B48B699.description:
The student can
identify facts or details about a
given topic or category.

96FF314EA8F14E2EBCE0E2EAE8132489.description:
The student can
write/dictate/draw a brief piece
about a given topic using facts and
details.

B3691EE1B44A49A6B362F6C076AB72A5.description:
Write to share
information supported by details

2D3163BD6158448F8005A41D3360B038.description:
The student can
select a word or labeled picture
that expresses an opinion about a
given topic or text.

755CEEB772254B61AB47070278654E40.description:
The student can
select words/phrases that express
an opinion about a given topic or
text.

91ACFE8447AB4460A7D729EEF4FDB1A2.description:
The student can
write/dictate/draw a brief piece
describing his/her opinion on a
given topic or text.

F966F4114D9F447A8043457E9A5FCCB3.description:
Write opinions
about topics or text

5BE90C43F79A4BE9901C634A5BBDD1A5.description: Students can produce writing for a range of purposes and audiences.

F55EF90613A84A789D58309341A6A22E.description:
The student can identify
the meaning of basic words paired
with pictures in narrative or
informational texts, including (but
not limited to) “feeling words”
(happy, sad, tired, mad, etc.).

5FC21485E0F040B797A67C4C4B539BF2.description:
The student can
identify the meaning of words in
one-paragraph narrative and/or
informational texts, including (but
not limited to) “feeling words.”

ABA67ED787C04EC9BEDBB299A96C412E.description:
The student can
identify the meaning of words in
narrative and informational texts,
including (but not limited to) words
that describe emotions.

387D2ED76A224768AE61A60EFBA00799.description:
Demonstrate
understanding of word
relationships and use.

BACD53C6DD2C4025BA17D40AC34CBF30.description:
Demonstrate
emerging knowledge of word
meanings: with guidance and
support, identify the temporal
meaning of words, when common
affixes ( -ing, -ed) are added to
common verbs.

A17F9FA74779457DB22016B38D20D6C9.description:
The student can use
simple visual and/or auditory cues
to recognize familiar words.

103931CEEB104321ABA35BD61840064D.description:
The student can use
semantic and/or syntactic cues to
recognize familiar words paired
with pictures and/or objects in
context.

C3C2737E911C49958056FCA93EE2FE2A.description:
The student can
determine which word or words
best complete a sentence. (The
sentence may or may not be read
aloud depending on student need.)

EB1E535C9A464A66AC406D4E8723133D.description:
Demonstrate
knowledge of word meanings:
with guidance and support, use
sentence-level context to
determine what word is missing
from a sentence read aloud.

46B0882C6CA9471FA288E7462358549A.description:
Use letter-sound
knowledge to read words.

674053273699441C8DDAF74838BC7A6B.description:
Demonstrate
understanding of text while
actively engaged in shared
reading of history/social studies,
science, and technical texts.

69B231CA1B4048A6B8EB1790238C11CF.description:
Identify similarities
between two texts on the same
topic.

823FC6AF717D48ED8557691C01902347.description:
Identify two related
points the author makes in an
informational text.

75A2CE321A88476B8CC99C746423CF68.description:
The student can use
visual representations of
information (e.g., charts, posters,
schedules, pictures, etc.) to identify
a single detail or idea.

ED352A4A1FD44CAA93176C6683D51880.description:
The student can use
visual representations of
information (e.g., charts, posters,
schedules, pictures, etc.) to answer
who and/or what questions.

503439C46E1447189A3610BDBCBD8791.description:
The student can use
more complex visuals (e.g.,
pictures, illustrations, posters,
schedules, photographs, etc.) to
demonstrate understanding of
text/information.

2D1017E5BC4F42FFBA8C12B876A90A18.description:
Use information
gained from visual elements and
words in the text to answer
explicit who and what questions.

52A19393CFB34F98B3B99C51C00807DA.description:
Identify personal point
of view about a text.

DECE06C25DC4455BA1D016BE5C0C0424.description:
With guidance and
support, use text features
including headings and key words
to locate information in a text.

9BACC7CED0464098BFB308EAF1C15147.description:
Determine words and
phrases that complete literal
sentences in a text.

6624B5A2C5304500922298AB24E109D7.description:
Order two events from
a text as "first" and "next".

3F782D31EE5A426190C3DDE77E22A50F.description:
The student can
identify one detail (fact, event,
idea) in a short informational text.

8F51734A334D4721939AF4A5ADC9B50B.description:
The student can
answer questions about basic
details (e.g., individuals, locations,
and events) in an informational
text.

E9A11E43F4634B53A2F5D6430C0A489A.description:
The student can
answer questions about details
(e.g., individuals, events, locations,
ideas, and/or sequence of events)
in an informational text.

DAF69EE31FA04AD1B4B9C4A59763C5E5.description:
Answer who and what
questions to demonstrate
understanding of details in a text.

490A1F3C842E432C97970FC42A6DF0ED.description:
Demonstrate
understanding while actively
engaged in shared reading of
stories, dramas and poetry.

21666ABDDF1C46B39265726C68D51DBC.description:
Identify common
elements in two stories in a
series.

AEF468862E0641B288C84496FDAFB9E9.description:
Identify parts of
illustrations or tactual
information that depict a
particular setting, or event.

81FD3AEA3E5E4FEBB6EE25367A1C4795.description:
Identify personal point
of view about a text.

C835536DACB0478EB9CF95D07A3B777F.description:
The student can
demonstrate understanding of
sequence in a familiar routine or
simple narrative text.

FDEE0C3AC9C049AF90BCE9D3E586F921.description:
The student can
identify when a simple story
element occurred (e.g., at the
beginning/end of a narrative, what
happened first/last, etc.) in a one-paragraph narrative text.

681D0A67BF14402BB2035E7F3672D4CA.description:
The student can
identify events that occur at the
beginning, middle, and/or end of a
multiple-paragraph narrative text.

C3C11F82AA334C33BF58F1CC0C183871.description:
Determine the
beginning, middle and end of a
familiar story with a logical order.

3AC97403883B4EDEAFAB8D1974059ACC.description:
Determine words and
phrases that complete literal
sentences in a text.

95AC8C7A1A884444B23CBFE615274C87.description:
Identify the feelings of
characters in a story.

0709CC5C6FD9443FBC32AC5628FE3904.description:
Associate details with
events in stories from diverse
cultures.

E74B01C9F3B94ADAB0C2FEDDDAB569C7.description:
The student can
answer simple who, what or where
questions about a narrative text.

EA676EC3ADEE4907989C8FB621A79FD2.description:
The student can
answer questions about basic
elements in a narrative text (e.g.,
characters’ names, settings, and
specific events).

DA3BE267426C44B293CA2FC23B68AD53.description:
The student can use
details to answer questions about
the plot, setting, and characters in
a narrative text.

6FB410684D164EA2BE6B74D18DADE076.description:
Answer who and what
questions to demonstrate
understanding of details in a text.

657664E34FC740D6B163598EE87B7D50.description: Students can comprehend text in increasingly complex ways.
